It is a rich source of vitamin a, iron, protein, thiamin, riboflavin, niacin, and folates.

The chickpea or chick pea (Cicer arietinum) is an annual legume of the family Fabaceae, subfamily Faboideae. Its different types are variously known as gram or Bengal gram, garbanzo or garbanzo bean, or Egyptian pea. Chickpea seeds are high in protein. How to Use:
Wash (whole / dals) pulses, it is best to rinse them under running water. Put your grains to wash in a bowl and hold it under running water. Rub the grains with your hands gently. Rinse it until the water becomes clear.                                                                                                 Use a large saucepan or cooking container, as pulses double or triple in volume during cooking. (Dry pulses will yield approximately 2-3 times their original amount when cooked.) Bring water to a boil, cover tightly, reduce heat and simmer until pulses are just tender and not mushy.

product_desc: Heart Care Oil - Infused With Arjuna, For Healthy Heart
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Making the right choices in your daily routine can go a long way in taking care of heart health & a critical choice is the oil you use. Dabur Heart Care Oil is a blend of heart-healthy oils with the cardio-tonic herb Arjuna, the bark of the Arjuna Terminalia tree. Arjuna is an ancient Ayurvedic herb that has been prescribed for centuries by Ayurvedic doctors for a range of heart health issues. It provides cardio-protective properties, helps in managing cholesterol levels and helps in maintaining healthy lipid levels. The antioxidant-rich herb makes it ideal to fight free radical formation. This ensures a fit and healthy body at the basic cellular level itself.
Dabur Heart Care Oil has the Power of 3 oils in 1, it is rich in Gamma Oryzanol which helps to maintain healthy cholesterol levels along with the goodness of heart-healthy fats MUFA & PUFA. This oil has a light taste and texture and can be used to make a wide range of recipes. Dabur encourages you to choose your heart health, consume minimal oil, and have a balanced & active lifestyle.

product_desc: Indian Spice Essentials - Pumpkin Spice Mix, True Cinnamon, 6 Premium Spices
about_the_product:
About the Product:
We're making it phenomenally easy to improve your life in a way, that will delight you every single day. Considering how much you loved our truly Indian chilli experiments, you'll be thrilled with what we've done with some of India's best spices. After all, we're a heat-loving nation second (see: fire), we're a spice loving nation first (see: flavour). So, after months of experimenting, we finally decided to make a truly Indian version of an international sensation that hits the right notes in so many different ways. A classic spice mix that has been around for decades and loved by people of different cultures, the Pumpkin Spice is much more than a 'fall flavour', it's a daily mood. We didn't make this flavour in a laboratory. There's no chemistry here. Just premium quality real spices blended to perfection to give you all the flavour and all the health benefits of each of the all-star ingredients.
What makes our Pumpkin Spice so unique is the perfect balance between some of the most intensely flavourful spices including nutmeg, cinnamon, ginger, clove, star anise and allspice. So when you add a dash of this mix to anything, no single note dominates completely, but what you'll experience is the perfect aroma, sweetness, and warm delicate flavours of these spices combined. And we honestly feel that everybody should be able to experience this taste upgrade. Adding our Pumpkin Spice to your beverage, dessert or soup is not just about flavours, but it's also so much about the feeling. It's like brewing an average cup of coffee and having a little sprinkle of some magic spice to make it taste like a barista's coffee. Ditto for your bakes, pancakes, french toast and more. Woof. And let's not forget about the Health Benefits.
Ingredients:
Bhut Jolokia Chilli Flakes, Rock salt.

About the Product:
Chhole is primarily a delicacy from the North of India, made from Chickpea. Sri  Sri  Tattva  Chhole  Masala,  with  its excellent mix of pure spices, is specifically combined to give you an unforgettable experience of this North Indian treat.
Ingredients:
Coriander, Chilli Powder, Mango Powder, Cumin, Black Pepper, Clove, Cinnamon, Anistar, Mint, Turmeric, Poppy Seeds, Big Cardamom, Anar Dana, Fennel Seeds, Tamarind Powder, Garlic, Bay Leaf, Onion, Mace, Bishop’s Weed, Salt, Nutmeg, Asafoetida, Lemon Powder, Fenugreek Leaves, Black Cumin, Kachari, Mustard Seeds.

Storage and Uses:
Simple Steps To Make Tasty Chhole Chana In a bowl, wash and soak 2 cups of kabuli chana (chickpeas) overnight.
Take a small cloth and put in 2 tsp of tea leaves in it. Tie this cloth firmly with thread, so that the tea leaves do not spill out.
Combine the 2 cups of kabuli chana, 1 cup of bottle gourd, 1¼ cup of water and tea leaves the bag in a pressure cooker and cook for 6 whistles.
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a deep kadhai, add 2 tbsp cumin seeds and 1 bay leaf and saute on a medium flame for a few seconds.
When the seeds crackle, add 2 tbsp Sri Sri Tattva Chhole Masala, 1 tbsp chilli powder, dried ginger powder, ¼ cup coriander and salt to taste, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 minute while stirring continuously.
Add 1 cup roughly chopped tomatoes and cooked kabuli chana and bottle gourd mixture.
Mix well and cook on a medium flame for 4 to 5 minutes, while stirring occasionally.

About the Product:
Each cumin seed in this pack holds an ancient story. The one where medical practitioners in ancient India proclaimed it the best aid to digestion. The one where a spilt jar of the spice got kicked over and was buried for aeons, then excavated centuries later as part of a Syrian heritage site. The one where it occupied pride of place in its own container at a dinner table, right next to salt and pepper, in ancient Greece. The one where its significance was recorded in the Bible and the Old Testament. Which one is your favourite. Is it the one where the seed travelled to the Americas with Spanish sailors who had discovered that it helped preserve food on long voyages? The one where it slowly became the mainstay of Mexican and Latin American food over the years, joining ranks with Middle Eastern and Indian spice blends? Is it the one where it journeyed all the way to the Netherlands and became a mainstay of cheese from Leden? We’ll tell you what our favourite story is. It’s the one where our cumin makes its way from our family to yours, landing right in the midst of the magic happening in your kitchen, on your stovetop, in a burst of warmth and full-bodied flavour.
Ingredients:
Cumin Seed

About the Product:
Puttu is the favourite breakfast of kids and youngsters in Kerala. Puttu is also famous in Tamil Nadu. Basically, puttu is steamed cylinders of ground rice layered with grated coconut. The rice powder used for Puttu is different from all other varieties of rice batter which is used for traditional South Indian breakfast because of its coarse nature and drier texture. Nirapara Puttu Powder is an ideal mix or pure rice, coarse ground to make puttu tasty. Steam passes through the thick cylinder due to the coarse nature of the ground rice and multiple layers of grated coconut. This also provides its own aroma and taste and tops up the sweetness.
Ingredients:
Raw Rice
How to Use:
Wet Nirapara Puttu Podi with sufficient water and salt, and keep for 5 minutes. Prepare the puttu by adding required quantity of coconut scrapings.

About the Product:
Samam Rock Salt or Sendha Namak is one of the best sources of natural minerals and is relatively healthier than bleached and processed table salt. Samam Rock Salt is often utilized in the same way as table salt. It is used for cooking, seasoning and preserving food. It contains several essential minerals, is completely natural and unrefined and is of premium quality. It facilitates the cellular absorption of minerals and plays an important role in replenishing the body. It also helps in maintaining the pH balance. The Sendha Namak can also be mixed with regular salt in everyday meals. To know more, explore our whole range of products.

Rich in antioxidants.

Healthier than table salt.

Rock Salt (Sendha Namak)

About the Product:
Anardana is the dried seeds of varieties of pomegranate too sour to consume as fresh fruit; they contain a tasty, fruity taste.
Made of dried pomegranate seeds, it has a mildly fruity, sweet and sour flavour.
Used in sour chutneys, anardana is also used in pastries and bread.
The seeds are tough and sticky but can be infused into liquids or combined with other spices and ground to impart intense flavour.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 110,
Carbs: 25 g,
Fat: 1 g,
Protein: 1 g.
Benefits:
Protects us from free radicals.
It thins your blood.
Prevention of atherosclerosis.
It acts as an oxygen mask.
It prevents arthritis.
How to Use:
Anardana is used in Indian and Persian cuisine as a souring agent, much like sumac or amchoor.
With their sweetish sour flavour, they are a wonderful addition to vegetable and legume dishes like Chole, Dal Tadka and Aloo anardana.
Pomegranate seeds are also used in Iranian cooking.
It is an interesting alternative to raisins in cakes and other desserts.

Wash (whole / dals) pulses, it is best to rinse them under running water. Put your grains to wash in a bowl and hold it under running water. Rub the grains with your hands gently. Rinse it until the water becomes clear.                                                                                                 Use a large saucepan or cooking container, as pulses double or triple in volume during cooking. (Dry pulses will yield approximately 2-3 times their original amount when cooked.) Bring water to a boil, cover tightly, reduce heat and simmer until pulses are just tender and not mushy.

About the Product:
Naturefest Basmati rice is a type of long, slender-grained fragrant rice native to India. White basmati rice has more calories and carbohydrates than plain white rice. It also has a little more protein. The Basmati grain is distinctive in that it stretches more than double its dry length when cooked. Unlike other forms of rice, the grains only expand lengthwise when cooked, allowing them to maintain their characteristic length and slenderness. In India, a perfect kitchen never stops cooking with a new variety of grain. The dishes and experiments become even more flexible for individuals who enjoy rice in their everyday meals. It's the ideal rice for this all-around housewife. One packet is sufficient for cooking simple steamed rice, pulao, or fried rice. It has carefully chosen grains of constant quality. So, prepare to turn your ordinary meals into daily feasts with this rice.
Ingredients:
Long Grain Basmati Rice

About the Product:
Apricots are small, smooth golden orange-skinned, soft juicy fleshed fruits. They possess a sweet flavour with mild acidity. The bright orange colour is due to the presence of carotenoids, which get converted to vitamin A in the body. Our products are based on traditional recipes and are made from the highest quality ingredients that boost mental and physical development, increase immunity. They are an excellent source of potassium, iron, magnesium and carotenoids. They also contain considerable amounts of dietary fibre and antioxidants.

Used it to make cookies.

The dietary fiber in apricots increases metabolism, which improves digestion, prevents constipation and can help the body feel fuller, longer to aid in weight loss.

About the Product:
BB Royal Foxtail or Italian millet (setaria italica) is one of those forgotten grains that were a part of ancient Tamil culture. Foxtail millet, called Thinai in Tamil, is offered to Lord Muruga, the patron deity of Tamil Nadu. Foxtail millets are high in Iron content and these millets are totally pest-free. Foxtail not only not need any fumigants, but act as anti-pest agents to store delicate pulses such as green gram. They also control blood sugar and cholesterol levels & increase HDL cholesterol

about_the_product:
About the Product:
Foxtail or Italian millet (Setaria Italica) is one of those forgotten grains that were a part of ancient Tamil culture. Foxtail millet, called Thinai in Tamil, is offered to Lord Muruga, the patron deity of Tamil Nadu. Foxtail millets are high in Iron content and these millets are totally pest-free. Foxtail not only not need any fumigants, but act as anti-pest agents to store delicate pulses such as green gram. They also control blood sugar and cholesterol levels & increase HDL cholesterol.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 380,
Carbs: 73 g,
Fat: 4 g,
Protein: 12 g.
How to Use:
Add millet, water, and tsp of oil to the pressure cooker. Check the millet water ratio section for the amount of water.
Close the lid and let it for 1 to 2 whistles on medium-high flame for pre-soaked millet. It will take around 5 minutes.
For unsoaked millet, cook it for 2-3 whistles, around 7 to 8 minutes.
Once done, take it out of the heat and let the pressure release naturally.
Once the pressure is released completely, fluff it up with a fork.
Benefits:
Control blood sugar.
Improve digestive health.
Protect your Heart.
Provides quick energy.

About the Product:
You've enjoyed your share of yummy Marathi-Kannadiga snacks, now meet the rice that's used! Indrayani Rice is a short-grain variety of rice that is commonly grown in the Maharashtra region. It has a unique aroma and flavour and is slightly sticky when cooked. Indrayani Rice is often used in traditional Maharashtrian dishes like Vada Pav, Bhakri, and Masale Bhaat. It is also used to make Idli, Dosa, and other South Indian delicacies. Indrayani Rice is high in carbohydrates and low in fat and is a good source of energy for the body. We bring you this beloved staple food now in 5kg, so you can store in bulk and enjoy all its varieties for a long time. Gudmom prides itself on promoting and providing organic foods, so check out their range of healthy foods only on Big Basket: Rices, Lentils, Seeds, Spices.
Ingredients:
White Indrayani Rice
Nutritional Facts:
Total Fat 2g
Sodium 2%
Total Carbohydrate 3%
How to Use:
1. Wash out and rinse the rice before preparation.
2. Measure rice in a grain: water ratio of 1:2 and boil until soft.
3. Enjoy with a variety of side dishes.

About the Product:
Keya Oregano Seasoning 50 g Bottle
Oregano Seasoning can turn Pasta, Pizza, Salads, Garlic Bread and hundreds of other dishes into a delightful delicacy.

Native to the Mediterranean region, Oregano is one of the most widely used herbs in the world. It has derived its name from a Greek word that means ‘mountain-delight’. Romans & many Europeans learned the use of Oregano from the Greeks and started using it in various foods and medicines. Oregano has an aromatic, warm and slightly bitter taste. Together with basil, it contributes to the characteristic taste of Italian cuisine.

 
Keya Chilli Flakes - Red 40 g Bottle

Keya hot red chili flakes are carefully chosen to add fire and exquisite flavour to your food.
Chilli flakes can be used while cooking or can be sprinkled on top.
Keya brings you 100% natural, organically grown condiments to spice up your meal.

It's a rich source of medium-chain triglycerides (MCTs), which are easily absorbed by the body and provide a quick source of energy. It's also high in lauric acid, which has antifungal, antimicrobial, and anti-inflammatory properties. Experience a healthier lifestyle by adding a variety of organic grains, oils, snacks, and more from Gudmom to your diet.
